publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-963 Roseanna Cunningham: Caithness Glass-That the Parliament notes with concern the decision by Royal Worcester and Spode Ltd to call the receivers into the glass-making firm Caithness Glass; recognises the importance of Caithness Glass as an employer, particularly in Perth and Wick; believes that the Caithness Glass name is world-renowned in the manufacture of decorative glass, and hopes that the Scottish Executive and Scottish Enterprise will give all possible assistance to the receivers in their attempts to secure a single buyer for the business as a going concern. Supported by: Rob Gibson*, Jim Mather*

S2M-963 Roseanna Cunningham: Caithness Glass-That the Parliament notes with concern the decision by Royal Worcester and Spode Ltd to call the receivers into the glass-making firm Caithness Glass; recognises the importance of Caithness Glass as an employer, particularly in Perth and Wick; believes that the Caithness Glass name is world-renowned in the manufacture of decorative glass, and hopes that the Scottish Executive and Scottish Enterprise will give all possible assistance to the receivers in their attempts to secure a single buyer for the business as a going concern. Supported by: Rob Gibson, Jim Mather
S2M-963 Caithness Glass (lodged on 26 February 2004) Eleanor Scott*
S2M-963 Caithness Glass (lodged on 26 February 2004) Michael Matheson*
S2M-963 Caithness Glass (lodged on 26 February 2004) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-963 Caithness Glass (lodged on 26 February 2004) John Swinburne*
S2M-963 Caithness Glass (lodged on 26 February 2004) Ms Sandra White*
S2M-963 Caithness Glass (lodged on 26 February 2004) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-963 Caithness Glass (lodged on 26 February 2004) Elaine Smith*
